Hi, Diego.  From your description, it sounds to me like the issue is
relate=
d to NetBeans' JUnit test runner.  I've never used NetBeans, so I
don't hav=
e any specific advice.  Can you try running your tests from
ant, using <jun=
it> and <junit report>?  If that gives the test results
you're expecting th=
en, that would tell us that it's a NetBeans thing.
Everything you wrote in =
your email looks fine to me


Todd.
